chapter.title: Circulation of the items
chapter.para: The circulation of the items in a library means the management of the copies owned by the library and their communication with the readers. We often refer to these as loan operations.

The vertical menu of the circulation tab contains 3 headings : Circulation, Display and Holds. In the Circulation section you can manage the readers and the loans. The Display section retrieves information about the items in the library. Finally, the Holds section allows you to manage the holds placed by the readers.

sect2.title: Loan Items
sect2.para: The loaning of items is very simple and can be carried out completely using a barcode reader. It is enough to enter the barcode of the reader's membership card, then that of the borrowed items. The barcode reader replaces the entry of the barcode and the pressing of hte "enter" button on the keyboard.
Naturally, there must already be some items and borrowers entered into the database for loans to be permitted.

sect3.title: Borrower Search
sect3.para: The creation of a borrower and thier card is explained later.

sect3.title: Search results
sect3.para: Example lending Rwanda : a people with a history, by C. M. Overdulve, to our borrower Luke Skywalker (barcode of their membership card is 100003).
His barcode is entered or read by the barcode reader to identify the borrower.
It is also possible to enter all or part of the borrower's name to in order to select them from a list. Here we will enter the letter "s" for Skywalker.

figure.title: Circulation > Loan (results of a borrower search)

sect3.para: Click in the search results list on the borrower Skywalker.

sect3.title: Borrower Card
sect3.para: The barcode of a copy of Rwanda is 33700003286792.
It is sufficient to enter this barcode in the "new loan" field to issue the loan. Enter and check the barcode. The loan is then added to the list of current loans.
You can then cancel the loan by clicking on cancel (in this case, the loan is not included within the statistics, compared to a loan immediately followed by a return).

You can also print a loan ticket. It takes the form of a PDF file generated by PMB. Under Windows, the "print loan ticket" button requires the Acrobat browser plugin and will display a printable loan ticket detailing the borrower, the copy loaned, and the date the item is due for return. It is suffucient therefore to click on the Acrobat print icon to print this loan ticket.
The launching of Acrobat to view the loan ticket may sometimes be slow, according to your machine. In this case, either be patient, or launch Acrobat in advance.
Note If your item has a particular status which does not allow lending, but this rule can be overridden, PMB will ask you if you want to force the loan or not.

sect3.para: In our example, the library parameters (name, address, logo) are configured for the Bueil Library. These parameters are configurable in the administration tab. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Utils section.

After having clicked on add a hold, you can carry out a search. When the item to be held is found, click on its title to insert it into the list of holds.

sect2.title: Return items
sect2.para: Scan the barcode of the item being returned. The borrower card is not required.
A confirmation message is displayed to allow you to check that the barcode does correspond to the item being returned.

figure.title: Circulation > Return items, confirmation of a processed return

sect2.para: This display gives the borrower name that returned the item. Following this is a link which allows access to the relevant borrower file, which can be used, for example, to issue new loans.

sect2.title: Borrower Groups
sect2.para: The Borrower groups functionality allows PMB to be used by librarians who wish to manage their borrowers by groups: classes, familles, etc.

sect3.title: Barcode for the new borrower
sect3.para: A borrower barcode is required whenever you want to create a new borrower. If the pmb.num_carte_auto parameter is active (has a value of 1), PMB will suggest a new borrower barcode equivalant to the highest barcode in the database +1.
For more information about the PMB parameters, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Utils section.
Once a borrower card number has been defined, click to reach the data entry screen for new borrower information.
Note: Validation (Click on the next button) is automatic with a barcode reader.

sect3.title: Enter the borrower data
sect3.para: You can enter the personal information about the borrower on this screen.

If personnalisable fields were defined in Administration > Bororwers > Personalisable Parameters, they will be visible at the bottom of the borrower file. On the following screen, you can complete the required personalisable parameters. To enter a different barcode, replace with the barcode of your choice or rescan the new barcode.
If you enter a barcode which is already allocated, PMB will give you an error message.
To ntoe :

listitem.para: A surname must always be entered
A forename must always be entered

The date of birth is not mandatory if the parameter empr.birthdate_optional is selected (has a value of 1). For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Utils chapter, Parameters section.

The fields OPAC ID and OPAC password define the login ID the borrower can use in the OPAC (normally situated at the left of the screen). If these fields are not edited before creation of the borrower, they willhave the following values by default :
for the ID : First letter of forename + surname.
for the password: year of birth (yyyy) if it is entered, otherwise 0.

the possible personalised fields are displayed at the end of the borrower file. They allow you to add all types of information to a borrower file. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Borrowers chapter.

sect2.title: Copy by barcode
sect2.para: Enter a barcode to display the information about the corresponding copy.

sect2.title: Item by author/title
sect2.para: You will see here a screen which works like the search section in the catalogue. (See later on the Catalogue chapter). You can enter a title or an author as the starting point of your search.
Truncations are usable here, using regular expressions. To obtain more information about this subject, click on the link "regular expressions".
You can also search for an item by it's ISBN, it's commerce number (EAN), or as above, by it's copy number.

sect1.title: Holds
sect1.para: PMB allows the placing of hold requests on items for a borrower. Holds are available in the circulation tab in a borrower file (item loans) and, depending on the parameterisation, within the OPAC, from the borrower file. (For more information about parameterising the OPAC, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide.)
Advanced hold management is available from PMB version 1.3 onwards.

sect2.title: in progress
sect2.para: In this screen, current holds are displayed. The rank within the file is specified if many borrowers have held the same item.

The holds are inserted as unvalidated. Once a hold has been added, the person responsible for the holds finds the corresponding items on the shelves, and holds (that is puts aside) these items. To edit the list of items to retrieve from the shelves, in the Editions tab, click on the menu item holds to process. (For more information, see ).
The barcodes of the items which then put aside are scanned. The holds are then "validated".
If you wish to delete a hold, Click the Delete option, then click on the button Validate the deletions.
You can print the relevant hold confirmation letters. To do this, click on the button Confirmation Letters

sect2.title: Expired
sect2.para: The screen of expired holds lists the holds which were not cancelled and for which the valid until date is past. You must therefore delete them. To delete a hold, select the Delete option then click on the button Validate the deletions.
You can, if you wish, leave additional time even with expired holds. In this case, do not delete the expired holds, until after the end of the extra time.

sect2.title: Items to shelve
sect2.para: The list of items to shelve contains held documents, which have normally been removed from the shelves and held with the borrower name, and then the hold was deleted. The holds are placed, in most cases, at the library reception counter; "items to shelve" allows you to take stock of the times which must be reshelved.
